snippet: In the first presidential debate, President Obama argued that government plays an essential part in economic growth, while Mitt Romney contended it should get out of the way.
abstract: News analysis; first debate between Pres Obama and Mitt Romney presents two ideologies about country's future that outline perhaps the starkest difference seen in three decades; at debate's center is role of government in American society in a time of wrenching problems, with Obama arguing that government plays an essential part in economic growth and fairness, and Romney contending that government should get out of the way of business.
lead_paragraph: In the first presidential debate, President Obama argued that government plays an essential part in economic growth, while Mitt Romney contended it should get out of the way.

headline.seo: Obama and Romney Clash Over Government’s Role
